Job Title: TIG Welder I 1st Shift

Location: Aurora, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
To be successful, you must demonstrate competence with TIG welding equipment. You must also demonstrate process capabilities to include welding of carbon steel, stainless steel, Hastelloy, Monel, Inconel, and other exotic materials. This role requires that you interpret technical drawings including geometric dimensioning and tolerance, and perform full penetration, X-Ray welds.

 Key Responsibility: 

 Follow current Standard Work with excellence, including accountability for quality of work performed.  Identify all out-of-standard and nonconforming conditions; alert Team Lead and/or Supervisor for remediation.  Understand and identify sources of waste in the workflow and work with Team Lead / Supervisor to eliminate.  Identify and propose ideas to improve safety, quality, throughput, and teamwork.  Execute and maintain a clean and organized work area following 5S methods.  Continuously learn new job skills within the workflow / plant to improve overall effectiveness of the organization.  Perform all work according to area and AMETEK procedures and Code of Conduct.  Able to execute standard work with support from others on complex tasks.  Able to operate Value Stream workstation.  Setup and operate all tools and equipment necessary to execute standard work, Proficient with TIG welding.  Minimal weld qualifications (SST)  Identifies problems in execution of standard work and request help from others on resolutions.  Other duties as assigned. 

Requirements:

 High school diploma or equivalent experience.  1-year experience.  Ability to read and write in English.  Basic computer literacy using Microsoft Windows.  Basic math skills and ability to use basic measurement equipment (ruler, scale, calipers, tape measure).  Ability to use various hand tools (wire strippers, pliers, wrenches, etc.)  Stooping, kneeling, standing for long periods of time.  Lifting (regularly up to 50 lbs.)  Specific vision abilities required include close vision, color vision and depth perception. 

AMETEK Magnetrol USA LLC (formerly Magnetrol International) provides level and flow measurement solutions for difficult applications including oil and gas. Manufacturing a diverse portfolio of measurement and control technology solutions, our product line offers versatility and adaptability to help our customers better meet control challenges, reduce operating costs and improve productivity. See www.magnetrol.com for additional company information.

At AMETEK STC we believe in building a sustainable future for our customers, colleagues, suppliers, and the communities in which we operate. We take an active role in promoting real change, by contributing to a healthy, fair, and sustainable society in many of the countries our facilities are located. We call it #CareForTomorrow!

https://www.ametekstc.com/about-us/carefortomorrow
